heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 3 cold snaps, with an average of 3.6 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: A significant windy period is on-going and is ranked 5th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 4 consecutive days beginning 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 217 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 216.5m lower than yesterday, 2.5m lower than the past week, 5.3m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 530m to a maximum of 1993m, averaging 794.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 796.8m and 789.0m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and the light is absent. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
